newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Highlights of Thursday's Commission briefing.
newsitem.headline: Highlights of Thursday's Commission briefing.

text.p: Following are highlights of the midday briefing by the European Commission on Thursday:
Spokesman Jochen Kubosch briefed on the Court of Justice judgments.

In answer to a question, spokesman Patrick Child said Commissioner Yves-Thibault de Silguy had judged that the European Monetary Union's credibility was not brought into question by the squabble between the German government and the Bundesbank on revaluing gold and currency reserves.
De Silguy said that the criteria for EMU would be applied the same way to all member states and that there would be "no fudging of figures", Child added.
The Commission released the following documents:
- IP/97/455: The Commission adopts draft ECSC budget for 1998.
- IP/97/457: White Paper on "teaching and learning" transformed into action.
- IP/97/459: The European Social Fund - 40 years of investing in people.
- IP/97/460: Commission signals rail freight freeways for Europe.
- IP/97/461: Towards a mass market for mobile multi-media communications: challenges and choices of the next generation of technology.
- IP/97/462: Countdown to 1 January 1998: report on implementation of the EU telecommunications regulatory package.
- Speech/97/125: Speech by Commissioner Yves-Thibault de Silguy on "Coordinate economic policies in the euro zone".
- Eurostat Memo No 5/97: A third of EU12 women are "housewives".
- Eurostat - Statistics in focus - Population and social conditions No 1997-5: Family responsibilities - how are they shared in EU households?
